Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the length of the filibuster, stating it lasted 75 days instead of the actual 60 days.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that not all Democrats were involved in the filibuster, as many Democrats from non-Southern states supported the Civil Rights Act.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or sources to back up its statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all Democrats tried to block the Civil Rights Act, which is not accurate as many Democrats supported the bill.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the role of Republicans in supporting the Civil Rights Act, as 27 Republicans also voted in favor of the bill.
